text: Hey there! What can I get for you today?
Hello! I want some tomatoes, please. The red ones.
Sure! These tomatoes are great for salads!
or you can just eat them as they are.
Fresh from the farm!
Oh, they look nice. How much are they?
It’s three dollars for a pound.
But if you want to buy a little more, I can give you a deal.
I'll cut you a break.
Cut me a break.
Oh, I just mean I’ll give you a better price if you buy more.
It's like a little discount.
Ah, I see! I'll take it.
How much are the apples?
They’re two dollars fifty for a dozen.
You know, these apples will really hit the spot if you’re looking for a sweet snack.
Hit the spot? I don’t understand.
It’s just a way of saying something is really good,
like perfect for what you need.
So, these apples are delicious if you’re hungry.
Ah, okay. I’ll take the tomatoes and apples then.
Great choice. You love them.
It'll be a nice little treat for the week.
Thank you. You really helped me today.
No problem! I’m happy to help anytime.
Have a great day.
Excuse me, do you have more bread?
I don't see any on the shelf.
Oh, yeah, we’re just about to restock.
I'm putting some out right now.
That's great.
Should be ready in a minute.
We always try to get the shelves filled up quickly.
I see. Thank you for your help!
No problem! You know, we’re always trying to keep things in stock.
Sometimes we run out, but we try to get things back on the shelf as fast as we can.
Why do you have to run outside to get more?
Oh, run out just means that we don't have any more of something.
Like, if we don’t have any more bread, we’ve run out.
But I'm getting more now.
Ah, okay. I understand now. Thank you!
You got it!
And don’t worry, I’ll make sure the bread is back on the shelf in no time.
It'll be good to go.
Great! I will wait. I’m happy to come back later.
Perfect! And if you ever need something, just ask.
We're happy to help out.
I will! Thanks again!
Hello! These are beautiful dishes. How much are they?
Hi there! Those are 5 dollars for the set.
They’re a real steal at that price!
A steal? Did you steal them?
Oh, a steal just means it’s a really good deal.
Like you’re getting something for much less than it’s worth.
Ah, I see! That’s a good deal.
I will take them.
Great choice! You really can’t go wrong with these.
They're in good shape, too.
Yes, they look nice.
But what about that pot?
Is it also a steal?
Haha, well, the pot is not a steal, but it’s a good price too.
Just 10 dollars. It’s a little old, but still in great condition.
I see! I will take it, too.
How much for everything?
Let’s see… the set of dishes and the pot...
That’ll be 15 dollas in total.
I’ll cut you a break since you’re buying both.
Cut me a break?
What does that mean?
Oh, cut you a break means I’m giving you a better deal.
A little discount because you're buying more.
Oh, that’s nice! Thank you.
I am happy with my purchases.
You’re welcome! I hope you enjoy them!
Hello, I’m looking for a phone for my grandson.
He's turning 15.
Hi! That’s great! I’m sure he’ll love it.
We have a lot of options.
Are you thinking about a smartphone or something else?
I’m not sure. I think he wants a smartphone.
What's the best one for a teenager?
Well, we have some new models that are flying off the shelves right now.
I would recommend something like this one.
It's very popular with the younger crowd
flying off the shelves.
Is it moving too fast?
Oh no! Flying off the shelves just means it's selling really quickly.
In other words, people love it.
Ah, I see! It sounds like a good choice.
What about the price?
It's a bit on the expensive side, but I can give you a deal.
What's the deal?
If you buy today, I can throw in a case for free.
Throw in? Why do you have to throw it?
Throw in just means I’ll include it for no extra charge.
So, it’s like a bonus gift!
Oh, I see! That’s nice. I’ll take it.
Thank you for your help.
You’re welcome! I’m sure your grandson will be thrilled.
Let me wrap it up for you.
I’m sure he will! Thank you again!
Excuse me, do you have any old jackets for sale?
Oh, definitely! We have a whole rack over here.
You might find something you like!
This one is nice. How much is it?
That one is 15 bucks. It’s a real find, to be honest.
It's in great shape for its age.
A find? What does that mean?
A fine just means something really good that you discover.
So, that jacket is great! You should buy it!
Ah, I understand now! I’ll take it.
What else do you have?
Well, if you’re looking for shoes, we just got a new batch in.
They're a bit worn, but still good to go!
Worn? Like... somebody has worn it?
Kind of. Worn just means they’ve been used,
But they're still in good condition.
They're just not brand new.
Ah, I see. How about good to go?
I don't get it.
Oh, good to go means something is ready to be used, with no problems.
That’s great! I’ll take a look at the shoes, too.
Awesome! Let me know if you need anything else.
I’m sure you’ll find some great deals today.
Thank you!
Hello! I want to book a table for tonight.
Sure! How many people will be coming?
Just me and my friend. Two people.
Great! What time would you like to come in?
Um, what time is good?
Well, we have some spots open at 7 or 8.
Which one works better for you?
Hmm, 7 is good. But... is it busy at 7?
Oh, it’s usually a little busy at that time, but we can fit you in.
Fit me in.
What does that mean?
Fit you in just means we have space for you.
Even if it’s busy, we can still give you a table!
Ah, I understand now! I will take 7 then.
Perfect! So, 7 PM for two people.
Do you want to leave your name for the reservation?
Leave my name?
Oh, leave your name just means you tell me your name,
so we can hold the table for you.
Ah, okay! My name is Anna.
Got it, Anna. Your table will be ready at 7.
See you then!
Thank you! I will see you at 7!
You're welcome. Have a great day.
Hey, Joe. What are you doing today?
Hi, Sharon.
Today is our yearly spring cleaning.
What exactly is it?
It's the day we completely clean the entire house.
We throw away stuff we don't need, and pack up items to donate.
We also clean all of the rooms, and wash all of the windows.
That's a lot to do.
Yes, it takes the entire day.
Do your children assist you?
Of course.
They sort clothes and toys in the closet and toy pens to donate or throw away.
Great.
But why is it referred to as spring cleaning?
Simply because it's spring now.
I see. I think my family also needs a cleaning day like this.
Our home is quite messy.
Jim delivers the items to the local homeless shelter after we have them ready for donation.
This makes cleaning the house simpler.
It's a meaningful job. I'll tell my family about it.
Well, I'd best get started.
I have a lot to accomplish, so I'll chat with you later, Sharon.
Goodbye, Joe. Thanks for the cleaning tip.
Hello, Sally. How are you doing today?
Hello, Karen.
I have a lot to accomplish today.
What do you have to do?
I have a lot of work to do like doing laundry,
as well as vacuuming the whole house and cleaning the kitchen.
That's a lot of work to accomplish.
Why don't you start doing some of it tomorrow?
My mother will visit me tonight.
I need to clean up before my mom comes.
I got it.
She likes a clean and tidy home.
I get what you're saying.
My mother is also incredibly tidy and well-organized.
I should have begun a few days ago, but I was too busy with work.
Why isn't your husband assisting you?
He did assist me.
Yesterday, he mowed the yard, cleaned all of the bathrooms, and set up the guest room.
Wow. He accomplished a lot as well.
Now I also need to buy some supplies.
What a hectic day.
Do you need any help from me?
No. That's okay.
I'm not really busy after work today.
I can help you.
So can you help me buy food?
I have listed all the necessary foods.
Sure. I'll do it after my shift is over.
Thank you so much.
You are so nice.
We are a neighborhood. Don't be so formal.
Ted, do you have any boxes you're not using?
I think I have. Let me check in stock.
Thank you very much.
Need curtains to move house?
No. Today I need to clear out my attic.
My attic is getting messy.
You should clean it regularly.
I know. I'm not even sure what's in there anymore.
I'm sure there'll be a lot of things you don't need anymore.
That's what my wife told me.
Last month, I had to clear out my attic,
and my wife said the same thing to me.
They must be talking to each other.
What are you going to do with all of them?
I think I'll sell things I don't need.
What did you do with all of your belongings?
I threw them away if they broke and donated the other half.
Great. Maybe I'll make a donation.
How many cartons do you need?
About 2 or 3 cartons are enough.
Okay.
Mommy, I'm not feeling good.
What's the matter, Susie?
You didn't have a good time at the birthday party?
It was a lot of fun, for sure.
But suddenly, my stomach hurts.
Oh no. Did you eat a lot of food at the party?
Maybe it's like that.
What did you have for dinner?
Pizza, cake, ice cream and potato chips.
That is a lot of food.
In addition, I had a Coke, cookies, and popcorn.
That's why your stomach hurts, Susie.
You ate too much, why did you consume so much?
It was time to eat, and everything looked delectable.
Susie, I believe you should rest for a bit.
Yes, mother.
Where are you going, Susie?
I need to use the restroom first.
So, what are your plans?
Are you going on a trip?
Yes. I'll be in Chicago.
My sister just gave birth to a child.
I'll be assisting her for a few weeks.
Great, send my congratulations to your sister.
Thanks.
Is it a boy or a girl?
A girl. Rose is her given name.
What a lovely name.
Yeah, this is named after our grandma.
My kid is named after my grandmother as well.
Marie is her given name.
That is also a lovely name.
Thank you.
Is this your younger sisters first child?
Yes, she is my first niece as well.
She is also the family's first grandchild.
What a unique gift!
Yeah. My mum is overjoyed.
She bought a lot of clothes for my niece already.
That's fantastic.
Sorry, I gotta go.
I need to go to the airport by 1 p.m..
Okay. See you later.
Hello, Linda speaking.
Hello, Linda. This is Sue.
Yeah. What's wrong?
I have a question concerning the flu shot.
What exactly is it?
Are your children getting vaccinated against the flu this year?
Oh, yes.
They did go to the hospital last week.
How about your child?
My child is also vaccinated.
I and my husband got one, too.
My husband doesn't get vaccines.
Why?
He says he is never ill.
This is also okay.
But vaccination is one way to prevent disease.
I know, but my husband doesn't want to.
Last year, both of my children became quite ill.
I simply want to make sure they're safe in case something bad happens.
Alright. I'll plan an appointment for all of us.
Let's have a picnic next week.
The kids will be very happy.
Great idea. See you next week.
Hello, Sue. I'm Linda.
Are you available for lunch today?
No, David is unwell today and was unable to attend school.
That's awful.
Is it a cold?
Yes, I believe so.
He was suffering from a cough and a sore throat.
My kid was also unwell last week.
He was absent from school for four days.
I hope David isn't too sick.
There is a virus circulating.
We must also maintain our health.
I know. To keep healthy, I've started taking additional vitamin C.
Right, me too. I'm going to go out and buy something.
Do you want anything from the store?
In fact, I do.
I couldn't go shopping since I didn't want to abandon David.
I get what you mean. What do you want?
Could you kindly buy a chicken for me?
I'd want to cook some chicken soup for David.
Okay. I'll buy a chicken for you.
Thank you so much.
Okay, I'll go to the shop after lunch and will arrive at your place about 2:00 p.m.
Great.
Then I'll see you.
Don't forget to stock up on vitamin C.
I remember. See ya!
Uh, Dad… is that steak supposed to be that color?
Yep! That’s what a well-done steak looks like, sweetie.
Well-done? Dad, it looks like charcoal!
It’s just a little burnt. Don’t be so dramatic.
No, seriously, dad. Your grilling skills need work.
Mia, be nice to your dad. He is doing his best.
Thanks, babe. How come my own daughter doesn't trust me?
Oh, I trust that if I eat that steak,
I'll end up with a stomach ache.
Ha ha! You're being dramatic again!
Mom, please stop him before he ruins all the meat.
Honey, if every steak turns out like your hair...
See, your mom believes in me.
My hair looks great.
So the steaks must be too.
No, I meant your hair is pitch black.
If you burn them all, we will have no choice but ordering pizzas!
I’m calling the pizza place!
Hi! I’m looking for some cream to protect my skin from the sun.
You mean sunscreen?
Sunscreen?
Yeah, that’s what we call the cream that protects you from the sun.
Ohhh, I see! Thanks for the correction!
No problem! Do you know what kind of sunscreen you’re looking for?
Uh… something good? Honestly, I don’t know much about it.
That’s totally fine. Let’s start with SPF.
SPF?
It's a type of number that tells you how well the sunscreen protects you.
How about this SPF 30 one? Is it good?
SPF 30 blocks about 97% of UV rays.
This one with SPF 50 blocks around 98%.
So not a huge difference, right?
Not huge, but SPF 50 lasts longer.
Also, we have two types of sunscreens. Physical and chemical.
What's the difference?
Physical sunscreen sits on your skin like a shield.
Chemical sunscreen goes into your skin.
Which one is better?
It depends on your skin. Physical is usually gentler for sensitive skin.
Chemical feels lighter so it is better for oily skin.
I’ll take the SPF 50 physical one then.
Great choice! That’ll be 29 dollars.
Wait! 29 dollars for this tiny bottle?! Does it last like… a year?
If you use it properly, it’ll last about 2 to 3 weeks.
Shoot! At this rate, my wallet’s going to need protection too.
You go first, Jake!
No, ladies first!
Fine.
Oh my gosh, The water is freezing!
Ha ha! You need to get used to cold water slowly!
You mean as slowly as how you swim?
You’ll eat those words!
Ugh! So cold!
I told you.
Let's do some laps to see who's faster.
You mean faster to give up? I'm sure you'll win!
We'll see about that!
There is nothing to see, because I'm not racing you!
Why not? Are you afraid of losing already?
I'm afraid I might hurt your ego.
Whatever! At least I can dive to the bottom of this pool.
Do you want to bet? I'll bet 50 bucks I'll win.
Is that what your dignity's worth these days?
Ugh, fine. 100 bucks!
Deal. Let's go.
Hey! You started before I was ready. That’s cheating!
Hey there, what are you looking for?
Hi! I need some yarn and tools to make a crop top.
But I've never crocheted before.
No worries. I can help you with that.
What kind of crop top do you want to make?
Like this one.
Oh, I know this! It's been very popular this summer.
Right?! Do you think it's hard to crochet?
It's actually very beginner-friendly. We also sell the pattern chart for it.
Awesome, I can't wait to get started! What yarn should I buy?
I suggest cotton yarn. It's breathable and doesn't make you hot.
Lovely! What about the crochet hook?
For cotton yarn, a 5mm hook usually works well.
I trust you. And can I get a copy of that crop top pattern chart?
Sure. Here you go.
This one?
Yes. What's wrong?
Ugh, it looks so complicated! I thought it was supposed to be beginner-friendly?!
Yeah, crocheting it is beginner-friendly. Reading the chart is a different story though.
Ugh, it's really pouring out there today. Hope it stops soon.
Hey, can I borrow your car? Mine's still in the shop.
I'm not sure you should go out right now, honey.
It's pretty dangerous to drive in this downpour.
But I need to buy some bread today.
Why? I'm pretty sure we have a loaf or two left in the cupboard.
No, no. I need sourdough bread. And it has to be freshly baked!
It's not the end of the world, honey. We can survive with regular bread.
You don't get it! I'm going to a potluck party at Chloe's today.
So?
And I promised I would bring homemade sourdough bread!
Why would you promise something like that?
You don't even know how to bake.
But everyone else is making their own dishes...
What am I supposed to do?
Pray a loaf of sourdough magically appears on our porch?
Nope! Let's pray this rain doesn't stop, so that potluck party gets canceled!
Excuse me! Do you mind if I sit here?
Not at all! Go for it!
It's a lovely day, isn't it?
Yeah. It's perfect.
My family is having a barbecue party today, so I'm glad the weather is so nice.
A BBQ on a weekday?
Yep, it's kind of a tradition for us. Wednesday party!
How fun! My daughter is always swamped with work during the week.
She barely has time to eat properly, let alone have a party.
Oh, really? That must make you feel a bit lonely.
Yeah, sometimes. But we do go to the park on weekends.
Not every week, but maybe two or three times a month.
That sounds sweet! My family comes to the park once in a while, too.
Which park do you usually go to?
The park downtown. My daughter loves the playground there.
You mean your granddaughter?
No, my daughter.
Oh! How old is your daughter?
She is twenty-five.
Twenty-five? And she still plays on the playground?
Oh, absolutely!
She loves the swings and slides. I guess like mother, like daughter!
I do, too. But I always I thought I was too old for that.
Age is just a number when you're on the playground!
Hey, do you want to come to the movie tonight?
Sorry. I can't. My sister is cooking dinner now.
So? Can't you eat later?
You don't understand. When my sister cooks, it's a family emergency.
Come on, how bad can her cooking be?
It's not about the food. It's about the fire hazard she might cause.
Is that really that serious?
Yes! Last time she tried to make "burnt cheesecake,"
she nearly burnt down the kitchen.
Ugh... Did the cheesecake at least taste good?
I have no idea. It got burned with the stove!
Maybe that was just a one-off. Don't be so hard on her.
No, I wouldn't be saying this if she hadn't already set the kitchen on fire once before!
Maybe she'll catch on to fire safety this time?
Or the kitchen will catch fire this time.
I'm not taking the risk.
